channel.title: Comments for Justin's Blog
channel.description: One for the money, two for the show...

item.title: Comment on Logitech Harmony 880 Surgery by Johnny Angell
item.dc:creator: Johnny Angell
item.description: Justin, you posted your fix for the logitech 880 volume buttons back in 2008. How is the fix holding up? My 880 is giving me the same problem.
item.content:encoded: Justin, you posted your fix for the logitech 880 volume buttons back in 2008. How is the fix holding up? My 880 is giving me the same problem.

item.title: Comment on Poor Man’s Wifi by nathan

item.description: well what happen to Treah wifi ?

item.title: Comment on About Me by Alex Barrett
item.dc:creator: Alex Barrett
item.description: Hi Justin, I am a reporter covering enterprise servers for TechTarget. I saw your tweet about SPARC T3 servers today and would love to ask you a few questions. Can you please email me at abarrett@techtarget.com if you're available? Thanks, alex
item.content:encoded:
Hi Justin,
I am a reporter covering enterprise servers for TechTarget. I saw your tweet about SPARC T3 servers today and would love to ask you a few questions. Can you please email me at abarrett@techtarget.com if you’re available? Thanks, alex

item.title: Comment on Halo 3 and NAT by Dave
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
I know this is a old responce but Norton 360 shouldn't come into it. Unless you are using a windows PC as a router to the internet.. in which case I hope you have more brains then to use Norton 360 and have enough to work out how to configure port forwarding.....
NAT is a method of using one public IP address and having serveral "Private" IP addresses on an internal private network. NAT port forwarding lets you allow certian applications access to set machines on your private side.
more or less anyway.
item.content:encoded:
I know this is a old responce but Norton 360 shouldn’t come into it. Unless you are using a windows PC as a router to the internet.. in which case I hope you have more brains then to use Norton 360 and have enough to work out how to configure port forwarding…..

NAT is a method of using one public IP address and having serveral “Private” IP addresses on an internal private network. NAT port forwarding lets you allow certian applications access to set machines on your private side.

more or less anyway.

item.dc:creator: Ryan S.
item.description: So if i have norton 360 how would i change/configure the ports i needed?
item.content:encoded: So if i have norton 360 how would i change/configure the ports i needed?

item.title: Comment on OSX 10.5 Printing to Windows Printer by Faisal

Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
Excellent – that’s exactly what I was looking for. The tip about the “Advanced” button was what I was missing.

Thanks!
